verses.text: And of the blue, and purple, and scarlet, they made clothes of service, to do service in the holy \add place\add*, and made the holy garments for Aaron; as the \sc Lord\sc* commanded Moses.
And he made the ephod \add of\add* gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.

And they did beat the gold into thin plates, and cut \add it into\add* wires, to work \add it\add* in the blue, and in the purple, and in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, \add with\add* cunning work.
They made shoulderpieces for it, to couple \add it\add* together: by the two edges was it coupled together.

And the curious girdle of his ephod, that \add was\add* upon it, \add was\add* of the same, according to the work thereof; \add of\add* gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen; as the \sc Lord\sc* commanded Moses.
And they wrought onyx stones inclosed \add in\add* ouches \add of\add* gold, graven \add as\add* signets are graven, with the names of the children of Israel.
And he put them on the shoulders of the ephod, \add that they should be\add* stones for a memorial to the children of Israel; as the \sc Lord\sc* commanded Moses.
And he made the breastplate \add of\add* cunning work, like the work of the ephod; \add of\add* gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
It was foursquare; they made the breastplate double: a span \add was\add* the length thereof, and a span the breadth thereof, \add being\add* doubled.
And they set in it four rows of stones: \add the first\add* row \add was\add* a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle: \add this was\add* the first row.
And the second row, an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
And the third row, a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.
And the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper: \add they were\add* inclosed \add in\add* ouches \add of\add* gold in their inclosings.

And the stones \add were\add* according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, \add like\add* the engravings of a signet, every one with his name, according to the twelve tribes.
And they made upon the breastplate chains at the ends, \add of\add* wreathen work \add of\add* pure gold.
And they made two ouches \add of\add* gold, and two gold rings; and put the two rings in the two ends of the breastplate.
And they put the two wreathen \add chains of\add* gold in the two rings on the ends of the breastplate.
And the two ends of the two wreathen \add chains\add* they fastened in the two ouches, and put them on the shoulderpieces of the ephod, before it.
And they made two rings of gold, and put \add them\add* on the two ends of the breastplate, upon the border of it, which \add was\add* on the side of the ephod inward.

And they made two \add other\add* golden rings, and put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath, toward the forepart of it, over against the \add other\add* coupling thereof, above the curious girdle of the ephod.

And they did bind the breastplate by his rings unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that \add it\add* might be above the curious girdle of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not be loosed from the ephod; as the \sc Lord\sc* commanded Moses.
And he made the robe of the ephod \add of\add* woven work, all of blue.
And \add there was\add* a hole in the midst of the robe, as the hole of an habergeon, \add with\add* a band round about the hole, \add that\add* it should not rend.
And they made upon the hems of the robe pomegranates of blue, and purple, and scarlet, \add and\add* twined \add linen\add*.
And they made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates upon the hem of the robe, round about between the pomegranates;
a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, round about the hem of the robe to minister \add in;\add* as the \sc Lord\sc* commanded Moses.
And they made coats \add of\add* fine linen \add of\add* woven work for Aaron, and for his sons,
and a mitre \add of\add* fine linen, and goodly bonnets \add of\add* fine linen, and linen breeches \add of\add* fine twined linen,
and a girdle \add of\add* fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, \add of\add* needlework; as the \sc Lord\sc* commanded Moses.
And they made the plate of the holy crown \add of\add* pure gold, and wrote upon it a writing, \add like to\add* the engravings of a signet, HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
And they tied unto it a lace of blue, to fasten \add it\add* on high upon the mitre; as the \sc Lord\sc* commanded Moses.
Thus was all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation finished: and the children of Israel did according to all that the \sc Lord\sc* commanded Moses, so did they.
And they brought the tabernacle unto Moses, the tent, and all his furniture, his taches, his boards, his bars, and his pillars, and his sockets,
and the covering of rams’ skins dyed red, and the covering of badgers’ skins, and the vail of the covering,
the ark of the Testimony, and the staves thereof, and the mercy seat,
the table, \add and\add* all the vessels thereof, and the shewbread,
the pure candlestick, \add with\add* the lamps thereof, \add even with\add* the lamps to be set in order, and all the vessels thereof, and the oil for light,
and the golden altar, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the tabernacle door,
the brasen altar, and his grate of brass, his staves, and all his vessels, the laver and his foot,

the hangings of the court, his pillars, and his sockets, and the hanging for the court gate, his cords, and his pins, and all the vessels of the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of the congregation,
the clothes of service to do service in the holy \add place\add*, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and his sons’ garments, to minister in the priest’s office.
According to all that the \sc Lord\sc* commanded Moses, so the children of Israel made all the work.
And Moses did look upon all the work, and behold, they had done it as the \sc Lord\sc* had commanded, \add even\add* so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.
